title: Prisoner Release
opening: After his father's death places the mantle of leadership on his young shoulders, Ike agrees to continue as Elincia's escort.

The company heads to the Begnion Empire, the oldest and largest nation on the continent of Tellius. As Crimea is a former fiefdom of Begnion, the princess turns to them for succor, much as a scared child returns to a parent. Many in Tellius believe that without Begnion's might and influence, Crimea's reconstruction will be nigh impossible. However, Begnion and Gallia have no diplomatic ties and are further separated by an impassable mountain range. So the company is forced to return to Crimea, where they hope to locate a ship to carry them to Begnion.
Accompanied by Ranulf the warrior who has volunteered to guide them, the company leaves Castle Gallia behind. With heavy hearts and wounded spirits, they begin the long march back to Crimea.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Hey, Ike! I heard you're leaving. Going to Begnion, eh?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Hello, Ranulf. I was hoping I'd see you. I'd wanted to thank you for everything you've done. I'm glad to have the chance before I leave.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Well, aren't you the dutiful one! Hey, that reminds me...you were born here in Gallia, right? I knew there was something odd about you. You're awfully friendly for a beorc, you know! Oh, you might not know, but a beorc is what--

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I know what it means. It's what you call us humans, right?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Oh, knew that, did you? Well then, let me tell you something else. When we use the word human, we mean it much the way you beorc do when you call us sub-human.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Really? It's an insult to be called human? I'm glad you told me. I would never have guessed.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I should warn you, if you run across any laguz who call you that, be careful. They are no friend of yours.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Got it. Thanks. I won't forget.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: But I've digressed long enough. Let me explain why I'm here.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Huh?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Princess Elincia, may I have a moment of your time?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Y-yes. Of course.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: The king asked that I give you this. Please, accept it as a gift.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: What? May I ask--

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Within that leather pouch is twenty thousand gold pieces. Beorc currency, of course.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Oh...I truly appreciate this generous offer, but a gift of this magnitude is not something I can accept. King Caineghis has done so much more than necessary already...

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: The king is ashamed that he cannot, at this time, provide any personal support. Please. Will you accept his apology and acknowledge his desire to aid you?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: But...

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: No? Well then, let's try this...

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Yes?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: You accept the king's gift. Then, as payment for conducting you safely to Gallia,you hand it over to Ike...

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Um...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Come on, Ranulf. You can't expect her to accept this. And it's an outrageous fee, no matter how you look at it.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Twenty thousand gold for the life of a princess? Perfectly reasonable. In fact, it almost borders on insulting! Consider how you have suffered, the lives you have lost...Ten, no, a hundred times this amount would not be unreasonable.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I... I have reconsidered. I will accept the king's kindness. In turn, I will present it to my lord Ike...You will accept it, will you not?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I...I will. Thank you.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: No, my lord Ike. It is I who must thank you.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Well, now that that's settled, let's move on. Unfortunately, we do not have any ships here in Gallia. If you are to find a ship that will take you to Begnion, you must return to occupied Crimea.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: If there's no other way, then we'll just have to risk it.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: No matter how cautiously you proceed, you're certain to run into Daein forces. Keep that in mind.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I understand. It's too bad we're so short on soldiers...Still, there's not much we can do about that now. However, I will review our supplies carefully before we depart.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: In regard to your personnel problems, the king has decided to lend you what aid he can. Lethe! Mordecai!

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: I will join you.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Mordecai! And Lethe? Both of you? Are you sure?

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: None of the others could stand the idea of traveling with humans. I myself tremble with loathing at the thought of going to Begnion, but...When the king gives an order,obedience is the only option.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That may be, but having witnessed the combat prowess of the Gallians for myself, I know how fortunate we are.

intro.speaker: Mordecai
intro.line: We will not fail you.

intro.speaker: Lethe
intro.line: Hsss! I've no intention of becoming friends! Do not forget that...And stay out of my way!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Ha ha! You must forgive Lethe. Her tongue cuts as deep as her claws do. I will return once I've reported to the king. While I'm gone, please finish your preparations for departure.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Very well.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Ike, here's a summary of our last battle.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: There were no casualties, and no one suffered permanent injury. We fought excellently.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Hey, Ike! Hold up a moment. You know, I was thinking...Since this castle is on the way, we should probably stop by.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Um...really? Why? Is there something special about this place?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Why yes! There is! This is Canteus Castle! Daein seized it early on in the war Now, it serves as a camp for prisoners. I've even heard there are a number of Crimean retainers being held captive in the dungeon beneath the castle.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: What?! Are you certain?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Princess, I'm hurt! Of course my information is reliable.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: If we can rescue some Crimean soldiers they might decide to join us. That would be quite a boon, would it not?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes, it would. I think it's worth the risk.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: The question now is how do you open these cells and free the prisoners?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: The cells are certain to be locked, so in order to open them--

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Logic would dictate that the keys will be in the possession of the jailer. We've no choice but to steal them. If we're lucky, the guards will have keys as well...In either case, we must move with caution. We don't want to trade blows with the entire castle garrison.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Which means we stay close to the walls and avoid being seen or heard, right? All right, then. Our first priority is to get our hands on the cell keys...

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Hey! You there!

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: I have business with Sir Greil. Where is he?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: You're sorely lacking in social etiquette, aren't you? State your business.

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: I'll speak with Sir Greil and Sir Greil alone. Now take me to him.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: What you ask is impossible. Commander Greil is dead.

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: Well. That is a problem.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Just who are you, anyway?

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: Call me Volke. Sir Greil hired me. I'm in...intelligence.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: My father hired you?

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: You are Sir Greil's son, correct? You'll do. Sir Greil hired me to investigate something. You pay my price, and I'll give you my report. Deal?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: How much?

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: Fifty thousand.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: That's a bit steep.

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: And worth every penny.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I don't have that much...Give me some time.

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: So, you're willing to pay?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: My father hired you. He must have had a good reason.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Are you sure, Commander? We have no way of knowing if he's telling the truth.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We'll know when we see the contents of that report. Until then, let's have him travel with us.

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: So that's your plan, eh? Listen, you get the report when I get paid, and I'm not waiting around until then. I'll keep my information for the time being. Call me when you've got the gold. Stop into any tavern along your way. Tell the barkeep you've need of a fireman. You'll see me within an hour.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Hold a moment!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Intelligence...You said you were in intelligence, right? Is information the only thing you sell?

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: Come out with it. What are you asking?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Locks. Can you open locks?

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: Sure. Fifty gold per lock.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You're going to have him open the cell doors?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Is that wise? We've only just met him. There's no telling if we can trust him.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Volke, will you help us break into these cells?

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: As long as I get paid, I've got no complaint.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Titania? Objections?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: I told you before, didn't I? You're the commander. If you decide on a course of action, I will but follow.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Volke, I beg your pardon, but let's pretend this little talk never happened.

intro.speaker: Volke
intro.line: Hm. If that's how you want things, so be it. I wouldn't have objected to traveling with you, not if it meant steady work, but...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Any objections, Soren?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I abide your decisions, Ike, as always.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What do the two of you think?

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Under the circumstances, I think trusting a man about whom we know nothing is dangerous. I am opposed to this.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: If we want to get those cells open, I think risk is going to be inevitable. If we don't have to steal keys, we can reduce that risk and improve our chances of rescuing the prisoners. It's worth a shot.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Righto! I'm off. Good luck and all that.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What? Wait! You're not going to help us here?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Much as I would like to, I have a job to do. I will rejoin you when I'm finished.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Hmm... I see. Well, good luck to you then.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Yes, and to you as well!

battle.speaker: Daein Soldier
battle.line: Commander Danomill! The castle defenses have been breached! What are your orders, sir?

battle.speaker: Danomill
battle.line: What fortunate timing. We were starting to run low on prisoners. Do try to capture them alive. I won't have you robbing me of my fun!

battle.speaker: Ike
battle.line: We've been spotted. There's nothing left to do but fight!

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: You there! We've come to rescue you.

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: You're not a soldier, are you? Your clothing gives you away.

battle-talk.speaker: Sephiran
battle-talk.line: I am...a pilgrim. My name is Sephiran.

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: You're a monk? Why would they imprison you?

battle-talk.speaker: Sephiran
battle-talk.line: I was arrested in a nearby village, where I was tending to wounded Crimean knights. I received no trial but have nevertheless been kept prisoner in this place ever since.

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: I see... That explains it. We've come here to liberate the prisoners of war. You should take this opportunity to escape.

battle-talk.speaker: Sephiran
battle-talk.line: You will set me free? That is most gracious of you. If you've no objection, I would ask your name.

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: I am Ike of the Greil Mercenaries. Please, the cell door is open. You should leave while you can.

battle-talk.speaker: Sephiran
battle-talk.line: Thank you. Perhaps we will meet again, Ike.

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: You're from Crimea, right? Come on--we're here to rescue you. We've opened your cell. Now's the time to escape.

battle-talk.speaker: Kieran
battle-talk.line: Ah! It's you!

battle-talk.speaker: Kieran
battle-talk.line: I could never forget that squint! Knights of Crimea, twelfth regiment...your name is Oscar!

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: And you're... Wait a moment...You're Kieran, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Kieran
battle-talk.line: That is correct! I am Kieran...The same Kieran who has sworn himself to be your eternal rival!

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: Uh...Right...Kieran...So...how've you been? You look good.

battle-talk.speaker: Kieran
battle-talk.line: As always, your manner is listless and inappropriate. It befits one who would call me foe! You were discharged three years ago...What are you doing here now? Aha! Could it be...You dastard! You've turned your coat and gone over to Daein, haven't you? Rarrrrr! What despicable, contemptible behavior! Unforgivable! Have you no shame? You were my one true rival! Where has your pride gone?

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: The mercenary company I'm attached to serves under the command of the princess of Crimea! We came here to free any Crimean prisoners.

battle-talk.speaker: Kieran
battle-talk.line: The princess of Crimea?!? You're not part of the royal guard! How do you know about the princess?

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: Well, like I said, the princess is our employer and--

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: Aha! So that's your scheme, is it? You hope to distinguish yourself by meritorious service and gain the glory that is rightfully mine! Admit it!

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: Look, my duty is...

battle-talk.speaker: Kieran
battle-talk.line: Blast you! Curse your name! Curse the name of Oscar and all who call him kin! I will never let you surpass me! Princess! I'm coming! Kieran will be forever at your side!

battle-talk.speaker: Oscar
battle-talk.line: Whoa...He's even more excitable than I remember. Hard to believe he's actually a decent knight...

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: You're a Crimean soldier, right? I've opened your cell. Let's get out of here.

battle-talk.speaker: Nephenee
battle-talk.line: Who...are you?

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: I'm Ike. I'm with a mercenary company hired by Princess Crimea. I can fill you in on the details later. For the time being, you'll just have to trust me.

battle-talk.speaker: Nephenee
battle-talk.line: ...Very well.

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: You're a Crimean soldier, right? Come on! I'm here to rescue you!

battle-talk.speaker: Brom
battle-talk.line: S-seriously? I'm not dreaming again, am I?

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: I'm a mercenary in the employ of Princess Elincia. I'll give you all the details later. For now, we have to move!

battle-talk.speaker: Brom
battle-talk.line: What? The princess? Oh, happy day! Wait, let me stretch a bit...Ooo...Sorry, I'm stiff from this hard floor...Ow! Ow ow ow! Cramp! Cramp!

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: Oh, for the love of--Come on! This way!

battle-talk.speaker: Brom
battle-talk.line: All, all right! Hold on a second...I don't remember the king having any children...

battle-talk.speaker: Ike
battle-talk.line: There's no time to explain! Hurry up!

battle-talk.speaker: Brom
battle-talk.line: Oh! Uh, c-c-coming!

boss.speaker: Danomill
boss.line: Look who's come to play! I am so VERY happy to see you. Now then, are you ready to become my prisoners and live a life of eternal bliss within my lovely dungeon?

boss.speaker: Danomill
boss.line: You'll not escape...I will see all of you...dead...You will be exe...cu...ted...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I've brought one of the Crimean soldiers who was being held prisoner.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Ahem...I'm sure you are unaware of this, but I am..

end.speaker: Kieran
end.line: Princess Elincia!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oh...yes. Quite right.

end.speaker: Kieran
end.line: I am Kieran! I served under General Geoffrey, as leader of Crimea's fifth platoon. My platoon had the honor of escorting you from the palace during Daein's attack!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Really? You were there when...

end.speaker: Kieran
end.line: I was! Lord Renning ordered my platoon to accompany General Geoffrey and serve as your escort. Our mission was to see you safely out of Crimea to Gallia's king. But we failed you...And when you were lost to us...I believed my worthless life was at its end...Yet here you are! To think that I would be so blessed as to see you again...Such emotion...I...The tears...sniff...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Kieran, were there any others?

end.speaker: Kieran
end.line: Such terrific emotion...So--I beg your pardon?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Did anyone other than yourself survive?

end.speaker: Kieran
end.line: Of course! Though I was the only one unfortunate enough to suffer the misery of captivity. General Geoffrey and several of his soldiers fought off the Daein attack. They were able to slip away. Even now, they wait in Crimea, hoping for one last chance to strike a blow against Daein.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Geoffrey...He is alive? Ah...How those words drive off the shadows across my heart...Thank you, Kieran. Thank you...for surviving.

end.speaker: Kieran
end.line: You are too kind, Your Highness. The opportunity to serve you again is the greatest reward I could ask for. For as long as I draw breath, I will stand ready at your side! This, I swear.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: All right, we all know where Kieran stands...How about you two? Will you recognize Princess Elincia as the rightful heir to the Crimean throne? Will you fight for her?

end.speaker: Brom
end.line: Look here. My name's Brom, and this lass is Nephenee. We're just simple country militiamen from the same territory. Now, we don't know much about nobles and stuff. Kings and queens don't matter much when you're workin' the fields. 'Course, we know we'll be in trouble if someone takes our fields away from us, so that's why we joined the militia! This king of Daein's no friend of ours. And I hear he's doing terrible things, too... Vile tortures with rusty nails and...and more! What's going to happen to my family? I left them all back home, and I'm so worried I can hardly see straight.

end.speaker: Nephenee
end.line: If you can defeat the king of Daein, will this country return to the way it used to be? Is that what you're after?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: It is my hope. I may not be as powerful as my father, but I will never abandon Crimea.

end.speaker: Brom
end.line: You sound like a lady who stands by her word. Looks like my choice is easy!

end.speaker: Nephenee
end.line: Mine too.

end.speaker: Brom
end.line: I'll fight in your name. I'll help you and yours, and we'll send those Daein egg suckers packing!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Thank you.

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: I beg your pardon...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You're...

end.speaker: Nephenee
end.line: O blessed saint...

end.speaker: Brom
end.line: Master Sephiran! You live!

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Brom, Nephenee...Are either of you wounded?

end.speaker: Brom
end.line: We're fine, but what about you? You were jailed for helping us...I'm so sorry! Oh, I hope they didn't hurt you!

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: It is nothing to fret about. Everyone is safe, and that is what matters.

end.speaker: Nephenee
end.line: O blessed one...

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Pardon me...May I have a moment of your time?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Who are you?

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: I am a monk on pilgrimage. My name is Sephiran. Thanks to your efforts, I have been freed from my imprisonment.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: A monk? Why did the Daein army arrest you?

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: I was arrested in a nearby village where I was treating wounded Crimean knights. I received no trial but taken prisoner nevertheless. I was scheduled to be executed on the morrow. I owe you my life. I thank you from the bottom of my heart.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You don't have to thank us. However, I am curious about your situation. Why were you aiding Crimean soldiers?

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Do you question my story?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You're a monk on pilgrimage as well as an ally of Crimean resistance fighters? Under the circumstances, do you blame me?

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Tell me something, Ike. If you came across a wounded person, could you ignore his plight?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Normally...No, I could not. But in times like these, where it means risking my own life... I don't know. It's tough to say.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Ha ha...You're quite honest. However, if actually faced with such a choice, a man such as yourself would not hesitate. If faced with an individual in pain, you would act instinctively. Your body would not wait for the command.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Who...Who are you? Really. You're so calm, so full of peace. I can't believe you're a simple monk.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: If you'll forgive me, I must be going. Fare thee well, young warrior. I am certain that we will meet again.

end.speaker: Volke
end.line: ...Ike.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Oh, hello, Volke. What do you want?

end.speaker: Volke
end.line: I was thinking about traveling with you for a bit. I'll be in the general area, so if you need anything, you can call me. I'll help you out...for a fee, of course.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: What did you say?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Why would you do such a thing? In times such as these, there must be many parties that need...intelligence.

end.speaker: Volke
end.line: Well, you've sparked my curiosity. And besides...No, we'll just have to leave it at that.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: That's not acceptable.

end.speaker: Volke
end.line: Don't be so inflexible. It's not as if I'll be joining your merry band or anything. This is strictly business.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: And yet you--

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Titania.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: I believe this is a good opportunity. We will almost certainly have need of this man's talents. He is a dubious character at best, but at least we know his motives. Everything begins and ends with gold. He'll be easy to control.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Soren, he's standing right there.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: I don't think he minds.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: What will it be, Ike? The decision's yours.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Very well. You may do as you like.

end.speaker: Volke
end.line: Excellent. Call me if you need anything.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I'm sorry, but I cannot accept your proposition. However, as we discussed earlier, I will summon you when we have the fee for my father's information. Is that acceptable?

end.speaker: Volke
end.line: Agreed. Be seeing you.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: First the thief and then that monk...What an odd band of characters you've attracted!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Ranulf! Have you finished your errands?

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: All done! But about those two--

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Yes, they're both rather mysterious.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Well, the monk seems like a decent enough fellow.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Determining who is a friend and who is a foe is something I must be able to do. But it's just so hard.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: That's only because you don't have enough information to base your judgment on. All we can do now is press on.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You're right...

end.speaker: Tiger Laguz
end.line: You there! Beorc! What do you think you're doing?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I was trying to get back to my room, but I've lost my way. Can you tell me which way I need to go?

end.speaker: Tiger Laguz
end.line: It's this way. Follow me. Hey! Not so close! Walk behind me.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Tiger Laguz
end.line: Er... Pardon me. The king has ordered us to treat beorc with kindness, but... It will...take some time. It is difficult to fight that instinct. Perhaps some memory of the slavery our forefathers suffered at beorc hands flows in our blood.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I understand. I'll keep my distance.

end.speaker: Tiger Laguz
end.line: Very well...Let's go.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: All right.

end.speaker: Marcia
end.line: And so we put this guy right here, and this dealy-bobber goes there...and we're finished!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Packing, huh? Want some help?

end.speaker: Marcia
end.line: Do I want some...? Pfff! You're a hoot, handsome! I'm already done!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You're more skillful at this than I would've imagined. Or is it that Mist is woefully inept?

end.speaker: Marcia
end.line: Aw, the Begnion pegasus knights were always moving around, so I learned to pack quickly. They used to train us on it all the time...Go here... Pack this...Fun stuff!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Is that so? I can see that you have a strong sense of duty. Quitting the Begnion pegasus knights to join us must seem...

end.speaker: Marcia
end.line: What are you saying? I'm a burden now?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Um...no. I'm very grateful you're here. As I told you before, we're short on personnel.

end.speaker: Marcia
end.line: Oh. Good then! And I'm happy to be here! Um...say, Ike? You don't need to worry about me quitting the Begnion service. My decision wasn't based solely on my desire to repay you...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You had other reasons?

end.speaker: Marcia
end.line: Yes. I...I'm also searching for my missing brother. He may be a dolt and a scoundrel, but he's all the family I have in this world. Remember when you found me? When we were fighting the pirates? Well, I was trying to track him down. But every time I go looking for him, I end up in some dangerous situation with ugly boat monkeys trying to kill me.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Heh. So that's why you decided to join us, is it? I can understand that.

end.speaker: Marcia
end.line: So, are you sorry you asked?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Not at all. The important thing is finding your brother as quickly as possible, right?

end.speaker: Marcia
end.line: That's the plan!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You seem...depressed.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Look at who I'm trapped with! Of course I am depressed... And keep your worthless observations to yourself. All of you are so slow...I can't believe you're still not ready.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Sorry about that. If we were like you and didn't need to carry anything, it would be easier, but...We have weapons and things to get ready.

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: Weapons of steel are a human weakness. Without them, you cannot fight properly.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: But...Lethe, you're carrying a dagger, aren't you? In the scabbard on your leg?

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: This...is not for fighting.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Then what's it for?

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: I use it to remove small bones from meat. It can also cut fruit into bite-sized pieces. It has proven quite useful.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Hmm...

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: What? If you've got something to say, spit it out!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You despise beorc, but you don't mind beorc-crafted tools?

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: If something's good, it's good. Denying something's obvious worth out of petty spite is foolish. It's not that I...I do not despise everything beorc. If every beorc could get along with us as well as you do, I'm certain...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Lethe?

end.speaker: Lethe
end.line: This is a ridiculous conversation! I'm leaving now.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Here are two Crimean soldiers who were being held as prisoners.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Ahem...This may come as a surprise, but...My name is Elincia. I am the daughter of Ramon, king of Crimea, who was so recently killed by Daein's heartless attack. I'm on a mission to liberate and restore our homeland...And I need all the support I can garner.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: We need to know where you stand. Will you recognize Princess Elincia as the Crimean heir? Will you fight for her?

end.speaker: Brom
end.line: Look here. My name's Brom, and this lass is Nephenee. We're just simple country militiamen from the same territory. Now, we don't know much about nobles and stuff. Kings and queens don't matter much when you're workin' the fields. 'Course, we know we'll be in trouble if someone takes our fields away from us, so that's why we joined the militia! This king of Daein's no friend of ours. And I hear he's doing terrible things, too... Vile tortures with rusty nails and...and more! What's going to happen to my family? I left them all back home, and I'm so worried I can hardly see straight.

end.speaker: Nephenee
end.line: If you can defeat the king of Daein, will this country return to the way it used to be? Is that what you're after?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: It is my hope. I may not be as powerful as my father, but I will never abandon Crimea.

end.speaker: Brom
end.line: You sound like a lady who stands by her word. Looks like my choice is easy!

end.speaker: Nephenee
end.line: Yes?

end.speaker: Brom
end.line: I'll fight in your name. I'll help you and yours, and we'll send those Daein egg suckers packing!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Thank you.

end.speaker: Unknown
end.line: I beg your pardon...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You're...

end.speaker: Nephenee
end.line: O blessed saint...

end.speaker: Brom
end.line: Master Sephiran! You live!

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: Brom, Nephenee...Are either of you wounded?

end.speaker: Brom
end.line: We're fine, but what about you? You were jailed for helping us...I'm so sorry! Oh, I hope they didn't hurt you!

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: It is nothing to fret about. Everyone is safe, and that is what matters.

end.speaker: Nephenee
end.line: O blessed one...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Pardon me, may I have a moment?

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: And you are?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I'm Ike. I'm the commander of this mercenary company.

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: That must mean you're the one responsible for giving me back my freedom. I am Sephiran, a monk on pilgrimage. Please allow me to express my gratitude. Thank you.
